reviews.headline: Great thermal rollers
reviews.comments: These rollers give my fine hair much volume. It is nice to have a variety of sizes. Great value for the money.

reviews.headline: I have only used these a few times but,so far so good.
reviews.comments: So far so good.

reviews.headline: Leave a lot to be desired
reviews.comments: I thought these would be a great easy option for getting ready in the morning while taking care of my baby but they're more trouble than it's worth. They constantly slip leaving my hair more flat than curly. I purchased the 8 pack plus the xl pack consisting of 4 more rollers and it's still not enough. I'd spend less time curling my hair with a hot iron.
Love how easy is to use and doesnt pull on your hair like others

reviews.headline: Do not expect curls, expect volume!
reviews.comments: These velcro rollers are great for volume. I have bone straight hair with no volume and these brought my hair to life. I used Big Sexy Root Boost before blow drying and put the rollers in my hair dry. After that I did a little more heat to each roller. I did use clips. After I took them out there was a ton of volume. Of course it fell with time but if you want it to last longer add a little teasing. This is not for curling your hair, this is to add volume.

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: Purchased thinking they would be great. Found them to be similar to regular Velcro rollers   Velcro does pretty much the same with applying heat but less cost.

reviews.headline: Great for girlies with curtain bangs!
reviews.comments: This product does exactly as it says. I have fine, medium-thick hair and decided to get these to style my curtain bangs. They're easy to use and stick in place without needed a clip to hold them. I like to leave these in as I do my makeup in the morning and once I take them out they give my bangs the shape and volume I didn't feel like I'd ever achieve outside of the salon.

reviews.headline: Difficult Hair!
reviews.comments: Well, I have fine, thin hair. So, I started using volumizers which helps for about half the day. So I saw these at Ulta and thought those might be something I should try. So I have been experimenting with them. I used a good styling spray with different dampness of my hair. It was very full (fluffy) at first but within a couple hours it fell into a very straight style. BUT - the problem was the rollers had quite a few hair strands when I removed them. I would recommend these to people with thick hair!! I am 72 so these probably weren't the best option for me. My hair is long and maybe I simply need to get it cut short!

reviews.headline: Not self sticking
reviews.comments: These were advertised as self adhesive. I have thin hair and even when i grab very small sections i can not get them to stick. You need a clamp to hold them in place. I only manged to get tye very large one to stick on one small section. They also leave creases in your hair because of the way they lay. I wouldnt recommend these.

reviews.headline: Adds body
reviews.comments: These rollers give my hair the body I've been looking for

reviews.headline: Absolutely fantastic ❤️
reviews.comments: I have had issues with curls for a rlly long time and curling my bangs and these work perfectly!

reviews.headline: No good

reviews.headline: New roller user
reviews.comments:
I am new to the roller game- I LOVE THESE. They are pretty easy to use. The hardest part is diving my hair without getting it caught in existing rollers but thatll come with practice!

The one drawback of rollers- not just these but all velcro, is that some of the hair comes undone when you blow dry but that's to be expected!

faceoff_positive.comments: For years I've struggled with getting my hair to hold a curl, volume, or any kind of shape. I've used curling irons, flat irons, and brush/blow dry. I've had varying degrees of success with the aforementioned, but NEVER consistent results. I knew rollers would be a good option for me, but I will admit -- I was lazy and never got them. Until about two weeks ago when I finally ordered these and let me tell you ... my hair has never looked better.   Here's how I use the rollers: I separate my damp hair into chunks, blow out individual sections, and roll + pin immediately. Then I let the rollers sit for about 1-2 hours depending on how much time I have. When I take the rollers out, my hair has wonderful curl and volume, and it lasts! And there aren't any weird "marks" from the curling iron or from a clip (my attempt at getting the curl to hold). Of course, it is winter so I'll be curious to see how they work in the summer, but I have high hopes based on the result so far.  For reference my hair is medium length, naturally straight and "fine" but I have a TON of it which makes it hard to do it myself PLUS, it's heavy, so holding a curl is always a struggle. I bought two packages and always use 3/4 of them.
faceoff_positive.headline: Why did I wait so long to get these?!!?

faceoff_negative.comments:
I am writing now after ten minutes of actual terror trying to get one of the eight rollers out of my hair. 

My hair is long and fine, and seven of the eight rollers came out like a dream. However, there was one roller framing my face that refused to come out. Even though I had rolled it just like the others, there was no movement of any strand of hair, no matter what I tried. There was no "correct" direction to pull the hair... no "correct" angle... no "good piece" of hair to start with… no hair moved at all. It was very hard to hold back tears at this point because the only options I could imagine were either ripping out all this healthy hair or cutting out the roller about three inches from my scalp. 

When working on dry hair didn't work, I tried to use every "slippery" product I could think of: detangling spray, leave-in conditioner, and finally, Vaseline. I eventually got enough hair loose to begin to unroll the roller with my head still under running water in the sink.

This was the most traumatic hair issue I have ever experienced. I will be returning this product and issuing a serious warning to anyone interested in adding a little volume to their ends after heat styling. I had read reviews that Velcro rollers were generally difficult to remove, but I thought I was immune because I have straight, silky, fine hair. If anything, I thought they wouldn't stay in well!

Please do not try this product. I'm begging you. Not even once. Not even one roller. No product has EVER destroyed my hair like this. Please learn from me!
faceoff_negative.headline: 10 Minutes of Panic and Destroyed Hair
